criteria.name: Completeness
criteria.description: All critical nodes and relationships are identified and documented

levels.5: All critical nodes present, all significant relationships documented, appropriate groupings/layers defined, legend provided if needed, metadata complete
levels.4: Most critical nodes and relationships present, minor gaps in groupings or metadata, legend present if needed
levels.3: Key nodes and relationships present but some secondary elements missing, groupings incomplete, metadata partially complete
levels.2: Several critical nodes or relationships missing, groupings absent or unclear, metadata sparse
levels.1: Major gaps in nodes/relationships, no groupings, minimal or no metadata

criteria.name: Clarity
criteria.description: The visualization is understandable, well-organized, and uses consistent notation

levels.5: Crystal clear visualization, consistent naming/notation throughout, logical organization, no ambiguity in relationships, directionality explicit
levels.4: Clear visualization with minor inconsistencies, mostly logical organization, directionality usually clear
levels.3: Generally clear but some confusing elements, some notation inconsistencies, directionality sometimes ambiguous
levels.2: Difficult to follow in places, inconsistent notation, unclear directionality, poor organization
levels.1: Confusing or incomprehensible, no clear notation system, directionality absent

criteria.name: Accuracy
criteria.description: Relationships and dependencies are correctly identified and represented

levels.5: All relationships accurately represent reality, correct directionality, relationship types properly labeled, no errors
levels.4: Relationships mostly accurate, minor errors in directionality or labeling, types generally correct
levels.3: Some inaccurate relationships, occasional errors in directionality, relationship types sometimes incorrect
levels.2: Multiple inaccurate relationships, frequent errors, relationship types often wrong
levels.1: Many inaccurate or incorrect relationships, unreliable representation

criteria.name: Format Appropriateness
criteria.description: The chosen visualization format matches the complexity and nature of the system

levels.5: Perfect format choice for the relationship patterns, complexity level appropriate, scalable structure, right level of detail
levels.4: Good format choice with minor suboptimal aspects, generally appropriate complexity and detail
levels.3: Acceptable format but could be better, some mismatch between format and content, detail level inconsistent
levels.2: Poor format choice for the content, significant mismatch, wrong complexity level, inappropriate detail
levels.1: Completely inappropriate format, impossible to follow, wrong complexity level

criteria.name: Scoping
criteria.description: Clear boundaries defined, appropriate level of detail, purpose explicitly stated

levels.5: Clear purpose statement, explicit scope boundaries (what's in/out), appropriate detail level for audience, constraints stated
levels.4: Purpose stated, scope mostly clear, generally appropriate detail level, most constraints noted
levels.3: Purpose vague or implicit, scope somewhat unclear, detail level sometimes inappropriate, few constraints stated
levels.2: Purpose unclear, scope poorly defined, detail level often wrong, constraints not stated
levels.1: No clear purpose, undefined scope, inappropriate detail level, no constraints

criteria.name: Visual Organization
criteria.description: Layout facilitates understanding, uses grouping effectively, avoids visual clutter

levels.5: Excellent layout, effective use of grouping/layering, clean visual hierarchy, no 'hairball' effect, scannable at a glance
levels.4: Good layout with minor issues, grouping mostly effective, generally scannable, minimal clutter
levels.3: Acceptable layout but could improve, grouping present but weak, somewhat cluttered, harder to scan
levels.2: Poor layout, ineffective grouping, cluttered visualization, difficult to scan, confusing structure
levels.1: Chaotic layout, no effective grouping, severe clutter, impossible to scan, no structure

criteria.name: Actionability
criteria.description: The map enables decisions, understanding, or actions based on insights

levels.5: Clearly enables specific decisions/actions, insights explicitly highlighted, critical paths/bottlenecks identified, recommendations provided
levels.4: Enables decisions with some interpretation, key insights noted, some critical elements highlighted
levels.3: Somewhat useful for decisions but requires significant interpretation, few insights noted, limited highlighting
levels.2: Difficult to derive actions from the map, insights not highlighted, unclear what to do with it
levels.1: Provides no actionable value, no insights, unclear purpose or application

criteria.name: Documentation Quality
criteria.description: Adequate descriptions, legend provided if needed, assumptions/limitations stated

levels.5: Comprehensive node/relationship descriptions, legend present if >3 types, assumptions stated, limitations noted, insights documented
levels.4: Good descriptions, legend present if needed, most assumptions stated, some limitations noted
levels.3: Basic descriptions, legend missing when needed, few assumptions stated, limitations not noted
levels.2: Sparse descriptions, no legend when needed, assumptions not stated, no limitations noted
levels.1: Minimal or no descriptions, no legend, no documentation of assumptions or limitations

scoring_guidance.overall_minimum: Average score must be ≥ 3.5 across all criteria
scoring_guidance.critical_threshold: Critical criteria must each be ≥ 3.0 (even if average is ≥ 3.5)
scoring_guidance.improvement_priority: If below threshold, prioritize improvements in order: Completeness → Accuracy → Clarity → Format Appropriateness → others

common_failure_modes: Too many nodes (>50) without splitting into multiple focused maps
Hairball diagram with crossing lines and unclear relationships
Wrong format choice (e.g., tree diagram for network, list for complex graph)
No grouping/layering for complex systems (>20 nodes)
Ambiguous directionality (unclear which way relationships flow)
No legend when multiple relationship types present
Mixing abstraction levels in single map
excellence_indicators: Target audience can understand without explanation
Critical paths or bottlenecks visually highlighted
Clear purpose and scope stated upfront
Multiple visualization formats considered, best one chosen
Scalable structure (can add nodes without breaking layout)
Validation with stakeholders or SMEs completed
Legend present when needed, absent when not
